trans-unit.source: The Health report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you get data related to the performance and quality of your app, including crashes and unresponsive events.
trans-unit.target: The Health report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you get data related to the performance and quality of your app, including crashes and unresponsive events.

trans-unit.source: Health report
trans-unit.target: Health report

trans-unit.source: Health report
trans-unit.target: Health report

trans-unit.source: The **Health** report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you get data related to the performance and quality of your app, including crashes and unresponsive events.
trans-unit.target: The **Health** report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you get data related to the performance and quality of your app, including crashes and unresponsive events.

trans-unit.source: You can view this data in your dashboard, or [download the report](download-analytic-reports.md) to view offline.
trans-unit.target: You can view this data in your dashboard, or [download the report](download-analytic-reports.md) to view offline.

trans-unit.source: Where applicable, you can view stack traces for further debugging.
trans-unit.target: Where applicable, you can view stack traces for further debugging.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you had previously published apps and viewed performance data in the earlier dashboards, you may notice an increased number of crashes and events reported here.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you had previously published apps and viewed performance data in the earlier dashboards, you may notice an increased number of crashes and events reported here.

trans-unit.source: This is because we are able to include more data in this report to give you a more complete picture.
trans-unit.target: This is because we are able to include more data in this report to give you a more complete picture.

trans-unit.source: Apply filters
trans-unit.target: Apply filters

trans-unit.source: Near the top of the page, you can expand **Apply filters** to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by package version.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of the page, you can expand **Apply filters** to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by package version.

trans-unit.source: **Date**: The default filter is **Last 72 hours**, but you can expand this up to **Last 6 months**.
trans-unit.target: **Date**: The default filter is **Last 72 hours**, but you can expand this up to **Last 6 months**.

trans-unit.source: **Package version**: The default setting is **All versions**.
trans-unit.target: **Package version**: The default setting is **All versions**.

trans-unit.source: If your app includes more than one package version, you can choose a specific one.
trans-unit.target: If your app includes more than one package version, you can choose a specific one.

trans-unit.source: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section.
trans-unit.target: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the **Apply filters** section.

trans-unit.source: By default this will include data for all of your package versions, unless you've used the **Apply filters** to choose only one.
trans-unit.target: By default this will include data for all of your package versions, unless you've used the **Apply filters** to choose only one.

trans-unit.source: Total crashes and events
trans-unit.target: Total crashes and events

trans-unit.source: The **Total crashes and events** chart shows the number of daily crashes and events that customers experienced when using your app during the selected period of time.
trans-unit.target: The **Total crashes and events** chart shows the number of daily crashes and events that customers experienced when using your app during the selected period of time.

trans-unit.source: Each type of event that your app experienced is tracked separately: crashes, hangs, JavaScript exceptions, or memory failures.
trans-unit.target: Each type of event that your app experienced is tracked separately: crashes, hangs, JavaScript exceptions, or memory failures.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally filter the results by market and/or by OS version.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally filter the results by market and/or by OS version.

trans-unit.source: Crash and event breakdown
trans-unit.target: Crash and event breakdown

trans-unit.source: The **Crash and event breakdown** chart lets you see charts that track specific details related to the customers' configurations when a crash or unresponsive event occurred.
trans-unit.target: The **Crash and event breakdown** chart lets you see charts that track specific details related to the customers' configurations when a crash or unresponsive event occurred.

trans-unit.source: Click the section headings to see details about:
trans-unit.target: Click the section headings to see details about:

trans-unit.source: OS version
trans-unit.target: OS version

trans-unit.source: Device type
trans-unit.target: Device type

trans-unit.source: Memory (MB)
trans-unit.target: Memory (MB)

trans-unit.source: Mass storage (GB)
trans-unit.target: Mass storage (GB)

trans-unit.source: CPU speed (GHz)
trans-unit.target: CPU speed (GHz)

trans-unit.source: You can optionally filter the results by **Crash type**: crashes, hangs, JavaScript exceptions, or memory failures.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally filter the results by **Crash type**: crashes, hangs, JavaScript exceptions, or memory failures.

trans-unit.source: (The default setting is to show all crash types.)
trans-unit.target: (The default setting is to show all crash types.)

trans-unit.source: Market
trans-unit.target: Market

trans-unit.source: The **Market** chart shows the total number of crashes and events over the selected period of time by market.
trans-unit.target: The **Market** chart shows the total number of crashes and events over the selected period of time by market.

trans-unit.source: By default, we show you the market which had the most acquisitions on top and continue downward from there.
trans-unit.target: By default, we show you the market which had the most acquisitions on top and continue downward from there.

trans-unit.source: You can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the **Crashes** column of this chart.
trans-unit.target: You can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the **Crashes** column of this chart.

trans-unit.source: Failure log
trans-unit.target: Failure log

trans-unit.source: If you have included PDB symbol files, the **Failure log** chart will show details related to occurrences of specific symbols, including the total number of crashes and the average daily number of crashes per symbol.
trans-unit.target: If you have included PDB symbol files, the **Failure log** chart will show details related to occurrences of specific symbols, including the total number of crashes and the average daily number of crashes per symbol.

trans-unit.source: This info is based on a percentage of your total events.
trans-unit.target: This info is based on a percentage of your total events.

trans-unit.source: Near the top of the chart, we'll indicate what percentage of events was sampled to provide this data.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of the chart, we'll indicate what percentage of events was sampled to provide this data.
